full_summary:
# Tender Opportunity: Stage 1 - Trail Creation in Forillon National Park
### Contract Reference Number: 5P468-23-0284/A

Parks Canada is issuing a call for bids for the Stage 1 - Trail Creation project in Forillon National Park. This is a two-stage selection process, and bidders must submit a bid in both stages.

### Tender Description
The project involves the construction of a multi-user trail and two picnic areas in the Beaver sector of Forillon National Park. The trail will be built on pre-existing road alignments and will include two road crossings. The work will be carried out in two phases, with the first phase being the evaluation of the qualifications of interested suppliers, and the second phase being the financial evaluation.

### Requirements
The contractor must perform and complete the work by November 15, 2024. The project is valued between $500,001 and $1,000,000, and taxes are extra. All work must be performed in accordance with federal and provincial regulations, including the National Parks Act and the Quebec Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

### Instructions to Bidders
Bidders must submit their bids in writing to the Contracting Authority, and must provide technical and contractual information. Enquiries must be submitted in writing and must be received no later than five business days prior to the tender closing date.

### Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation will be based on the bidder's qualifications, and the lowest bid will be selected.

### Trade Agreements
This project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Canada Labour Code.

### Regions of Opportunity
The project is located in Quebec, except for the National Capital Region.

### Timeframe
The tender closing date is March 5, 2024 at 2:00 PM ET. The expected contract start date is March 29, 2024, and the expected contract end date is November 15, 2024.

### Contact Information
For further information, please contact Cloë Pelland Tessier at (418) 928-7252 or cloe.pelland-tessier@pc.gc.ca. Documentation and specifications can be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service. Late submissions will not be accepted.

### Requirements for Contract Award
Parks Canada retains the right to negotiate the contract with the successful bidder, and reserves the right to request clarification or additional information during the evaluation process.
